text: New hot sauce recipe: 10-12 habernero peppers. Take the seeds out of half unless you like pain. 4 large dried guajilla peppers (can toast them lightly in a pan for a few seconds for better flavor but either way its good). 3/4 cup vinegar. Half of a small onion. 1 tbsp minced garlic. Blend. Cook on low heat for 10min (caution fumes). Blend again and add vinegar/water as needed to make a pastey liquid.

text:
Skip the vinegar, add 2% by weight salt, keep all the veggies under the liquid (easiest way is to push a ziploc bag down into the space and fill it with water), and wait a couple of weeks. 

Fermented hot sauce is sooooo good

Fermentation is just so much fun. I haven't done as much since my kid was born, but used to go through 2 large cabbages worth of sauerkraut a month, yogurt, kombucha etc. 

Highly recommend Sandor Katz "Art of Fermentation"
